reviews.review: я уже давно ихраю страшна

Would I play it? Hell yes, 8.5/10!

Pros:
- Very effective if you're looking for a rush of adrenaline
- Great freedom in choosing between playing as a survivor or killer
- Very addictive once you get the hang of it
- Includes ranked and unranked modes to play with up to 4-5 friends
- Not very grindy at the moment
- Tons of mechanics and gameplay elements keeping you on your toes
- Free and paid DLCs regularly released
- Lots of meta shifts keeping the game fresh and encouraging the creation of new strats

Cons:
- MAJOR CON: the game has some intensive computer requirements, so unless you feel like your pc can put up with it you are at risk of playing at ~5 FPS
- Quite buggy, but generally not in any too game-breaking way (expect to need to restart the game and getting kicked out of queues on occasion)
- The game is constantly in a state of balance changes
- The community can sometimes be quite toxic
- Relatively easy to exploit bugs and tricks to your favour
- Can be quite repetitive at the moment since it seems to lack special game modes
- Steep learning curve, but it's possible to climb ranks with a decent understanding of the game
- (minor con) Few character appearance customisation options

Игра против охотницы: Из-за леса, из-за гор прилетел в е***(лицо) топор 
Игра против трапера: бежишь чинить генер, увидел капкан, решил обезвредить, сурв в него наступил,тебя поймали, ты умер
Игра против Хиллбилли: чинишь генер, прилетает этот гонщик и дает тебе по голове молотком
Игра против призрака: а это кто? их в игре почти нет
Игра против Майкла: чинишь генер, а Майкл просто подходит и берет тебя на плечо, ибо ПОЧТИ НЕТ СЕРДЦЕБИЕНИЯ
Игра против  Ведьмы: спасаешь сурва, ведьма телепортируется на ловушку под крюком и убивает вас обоих
Игра против Доктора(осторожно ragemod) : ДА ВЫПИЛИТЕ ЕГО ИЗ ИГРЫ,ВМЕСТЕ С ЕГО БОЛЬНИЦЕЙ,ОН ПРОСТО КАКОЙ-ТО КОНЧЕННЫЙ. РАДАР КОТОРЫЙ ДЕЙСТВУЕТ МЕТРОВ НА 10 ВОКРУГ И ЕЩЕ НАПРАВЛЕННО,А ПОТОМ ПАССИВНО ПАЛИТ ТЕБЯ ПО ВСЕЙ КАРТЕ, А ЕГО ЕЩЕ И БАФАТЬ ХОТЯТ, СЛАБЫЙ ВИДИТЕ ЛИ МАНЬЯК У НАС

This game is quite good, the sound is scary, and the game is also fun.

I love this game. If you are a survivor it is the scariest and most fun thing you will do in this game the heart beat is terrifying thing to listen to. You know that the killer is near you when the heart start humping harder and harder untill the music starts play and you know your screwed so the only thing you can do is run so you do. and then you see the killer and you heart just drops. As the killer you get to hunt down servivors, it is a ton of fun to chase the servivors through out the map and there are a ton of different killers to choose from like the trapper or the wraith (my favorite killer). Same with the servivors there are lots of different people to choose from and play as. YOU WILL HAVE TONS OF SCARES AND FUN WITH THIS GAME.
You have been warned.

its a fun game but theres some issues i saw that i would like to let others know about before buying

1- i have lost all my progress  all of a sudden  for no reason .. and all the quick fixes i found about it online did not work 
even devolpers are asking for annoing stuff to prove i have lost my data in first place which makes it not worth the trouble.

2- playing as a killer is fun but you can not get kills unless your camping a hook since its almost garanteed that someone will come to you instead of you chasing the unknown and loosing your one hooked surviver. but you will get reported by players and hated cause of doing it so .. they want you to play as a killer and let them live basicly or you will be reported
which is ..frankly stupid.

3- its a very hard game for new players cause the lack of perks and such and with not knowing when you will loose all your saves for no reason it forces you to start from square  1 again . -_-

4-  finaly  as a surviver dont expect you will be saved cause there are many that abandon others to survive.
----
now for the good things i found.. free skins and stuff  they give every now and then and some of the new killers for free which is  nice. but thats about it.

Hey fellas
This game is great fun especially when you play with four friends as survivors. But the game has one very big negative aspect: You need ages to get the perks to handle the killers from the dlcs which are unbalanced af. So as a beginner you are going to have a bad time when playing against one of the killers from the dlcs. This makes the game often very frustating for me since i haven't played that long.

This game has some issues, but it's pretty fantastic.  I haven't spent this much time on a multiplayer-only game since Science and Industry.

Survivor and Killer are both a lot of fun to play, although I did prefer Survivor.  Survivor XP rates could be higher, it seems like Killers have it easier getting Bloodpoints each match (having played both).  XP rates in general could be a lot higher, the game is almost a Korean MMO with how slow the vanilla leveling rate is.  There was recently a Triple Bloodpoint event (3x XP) and that even felt too slow.

Maps being free to play even if you don't own the pack as long as the host (Killer) owns the map is nice, but the are still overpriced.

I feel like the game would have more teamwork from the Survivors end if you got more XP if more Survivors escaped.  As it is if someone's hooked and the exits are up, even if it's an easy save, most people will just head to the exit.  If you got more XP for having more people saved, people would be more likely to take the extra 15 seconds to get someone else out because it benefits them.

It doesn't seem to be optimized well, as at max settings it utilizes far more resources than it should, given how it looks and how small the tech is for the game (no AI to process, only five people total and the maps are medium-sized).

I love how the menu music is the same theme throughout, but each section uses different instrumentation.  Main menu is piano, Survivor screen is acoustic, Killer screen is distorted guitar.  The music doesn't stop when you change between these sections, this is what's really cool, it just flows into the new instrument for the section you're on, continuing at the same part.  It adds to the atmosphere very well, it's a simple technique but it's really effective.  Despite being a multiplayer-only game that has essentially no story except for what you find in the instructions and some quotes when leveling up/tooltips, it's a very immersive survival horror environment.

Entering the Killer's basement is always tense.  It's exciting to hear the terror radar go off (an increasing heartbeat), hide, and evade the Killer's vision by constantly positioning yourself correctly behind a tree so he doesn't spot you, then he runs off and you make a safe escape.  Or, working on a generator that's almost finished, the terror radar goes off, an ally baits the boss in another direction, and you finish starting the generator.  A favorite of mine is the escape hatches.  I still haven't figured out how to open one with a key (haven't got the right key yet), but at certain points in the game, there's a hatch in the ground that opens and if you find it, you immediately escape.  In one of my first games, I was the last Survivor alive, I didn't know how to play yet so I was just running around not sure what to do.  The Killer started chasing me, I didn't want to die so I kept running, I accidentally came across a hatch and exited through it.  I had no idea they existed in the game and that escape was so well timed, it's moments like these that keep Dead by Daylight so compelling even though it's "the same thing" over and over.  There are all these random mini-stories that happen throughout the game through the interactions of players.

A lot of people think the Huntress is overpowered, but I like dealing with her more than the Doctor or Michael.  The game feels really balanced.  Beginner Killers have an easier time getting rewarded than beginner Survivors, but as long as you get matched with at least one other Survivor that knows about body blocking/what chicken winging on the hook means/not to insta-unhook, the Killer is going to have to work for the kills.

The most frustrating thing about the game is when you join as a Survivor, get found and hooked by the Killer within about 15 seconds, and die because no one comes to help you.  You end up spending about 5 minutes finding a lobby/waiting for match to start/loading into match to die in two minutes and get 5k bloodpoints because of how RNG was with the placement and/or the other Survivors totally abandoned you that early.

Another frustration is the item system.  There are a few offerings that can be used that hugely tilt the game in either sides favor.  Pitch black lighting means the Killer is going to have a really hard time finding you, and the item that lets the Killer kill anyone who's downed if they've already been hooked by them makes for some really fast, one-sided matches.  This should be given another look at.

It's really good overall, I'm certainly not bored of it yet, but the biggest hurdle to most will be how long it takes to level up in this game.

那种什么     没有通过房主反作弊的检测，断开连接    什么与朋友一起开黑老是掉线   什么无法与黎明杀机服务器连接之类的

黎明杀机是一款非常有趣的搞笑游戏！（认真脸），在游戏里你可以选择扮演农场主或者是偷电贼，农场主为了让偷电贼更好的观看自己农场美丽的风景以彰显自己的财力可以选择把喜欢的偷电贼抱到钩子上，毕竟挂的越高看的越远嘛O(∩_∩)O哈哈~，可是嫉妒心驱使着其他偷电贼来争宠抢夺钩子，甚至不惜用一些情趣道具来吸引农场主的注意力以达到上钩子的目的（就是这样没错，信我）。
不排除有花心的农场主，也有很多专一的农场主，他们会选择站在钩子旁边陪自己爱的偷电贼一起观赏风景。容易被勾引走的农场主是守不住自己喜爱的偷电贼的，有可能最后一个偷电贼也留不住。但是专一的农场主也不一定能得到4个偷电贼全部的爱，这个就由农场主们自己去取舍了╮(╯▽╰)╭，没办法，偷电贼们就是这样磨人的小妖精。
那么你是不是也被这么有趣的情节所吸引了呢？来加入我们搞笑游戏的队列吧，跟着我一起偷电来勾引农场主吧！(*^__^*) 嘻嘻……

It is an amazingly awesome game filled with killers who will cheat and play very cheaply. So if you are okay with only having one game out of maybe 5 actually being fun then this is the game for you. The devs set it up so that the killer is the server host for the game. Pst, this means that if they are laggy or have bad internet you are in for a horrible time. The game is incredibly unbalanced between killers and survivors. And if you only have one or two friends you regularly play with then get ready to be stuck with the most scum sucking killers this game has to offer. On the other had if you have a dedicated group of 5 people who all like playing together and are able to set up full private matches then this is the game for you. Otherwise wait until there is more control put on who is allowed to play killer or until the devs actually get their own servers, we all know they can afford it. I feel like these are issues a free game should be having, not something that you have to spend actual money on.

Good game. Worth trying! ( Was my review years ago when I only had 1.5K hours )
Update:
The game is currently in a very poor state, probably THE worst its ever been for new players. 
The game is a grindy mess, more grindy than most MMOs out there. 
The MMR system they added is THE worst thing they ever added to the game and it basically reduced the playerbase by more than 50% in 6 months, and it keeps going down but for some reason they refuse to remove it. They encouraged a "competitive" playstyle which turned the game unfun for both sides.
The devs refuse to reduce the grind by simply removing the perks tiers cause the "the problem will eventually come back" and they wanna look for a more permanent solution. 
This is completely silly as the problem will come back in many many years and by then they can find a different solution, instead they refuse to solve the problem here and now.
Every OG Dev is leaving the company, its became a money maker instead of a game we loved to play and be part of, which I can understand but its killing the community.
号被盗了就很恶心了，别人开挂号被封了

Edit: About a year later, Dead by Daylight feels about the same as I remember. On the upside, the launcher has fewer errors than before. 
*The changes to the ranking system better rewards players based on gameplay over point accumulation. As a result, intentional disconnects and griefing occur less often than before. 
*Fortunately or unfortunately, deranking is a much more difficult process. Players who wish to deflate their rank to better match their more casual friends will have a more troublesome time. 
*Survivors' potential to infinitely abuse obstacles is now limited to encourage more variety during evasion.
*The killer's most detrimental perks are now objectives to the map. Although, it does get tiring when you have to look for the "ruin" hexed totem to cleanse during each game.
*Killers can actually antagonize survivors by sabotaging generator progress.
*The perk balancing feels better because now every powerful perk has a counter perk or strategy. 
*Low level survivors and killers can contend better with high level killers and survivors. That said, the disparity between seasoned players and new players still exists and can be even more overwhelming.
______________________________________________________
Tl;Dr If you like the idea and have the patience for single player, play it. However, you should know Dead by Daylight requires a considerable time investment to become familiar with the roles of killer and survivor, and it requires even more time to acquire the skills to play them to their fullest. Overcoming constant technical issues is a feature by now. 

Pros
+A-rate asymmetrical gameplay (killers feel bloodthisty and powerful, survivors feel helpless and depend on each other)
+Balanced to rank up killers and survivors based on actions, contributions, and proficiency not by which side completes their objective
+Killers and survivors are "balanced" (Killers claim survivors are unbalanced, survivors claim killers are unbalanced)
+Variety of characters with unique traits and gameplay styles
+Developers actively communicate and interract with the community

Cons
-Game-breaking patches (frustrating to solve, may delete progress)
-Inconsistent matchmaking experience (finding a lobby can take 2 minutes to 2 hours, lobbies may disconnect when high ranked players, groups, or certain characters join)
-Skill tree progression and ranking suffer when players disconnect mid-game (progress slows, and players derank)
-DLC characters in a game where each character can drastically affect the game (though skills from DLC characters are accessible without DLC)
-New killers often destabilize the game more than new survivors, since a killer begins with abilities while survivors have to unlock a skill(s) to address the new killer's strengths
-Ranking system encourages players to disconnect to retain rank and thus grief other players


Dead by Daylight is a brilliant example of asymmetrical gameplay done right. However, it is not for the faint of heart or the easily bittered. Regularly, players face the launcher, EasyAntiCheat, or drivers breaking or missing. The peer-to-peer matchmaking makes matches irregular and liable to intentional and unintentional disconnects. To further cause bitterness, patches have been known to delete progress, add characters that destabilize the game too quickly, and wildly change the dynamic between killers and survivors. If you have the patience for a game constantly in development, then this may be for you. If you have a group of friends that want to play this for kicks, go ahead. But Dead by Daylight is not a nice casual game to pick up, it will require some effort to come to overcome broken menus and matches that scarely reward the time investment.

Amazing game, if you have the patience to learn how it works and improve your gameplay. 

Constantly updated and the devs have come a long way in communication and game balancing, new characters are being added fairly regularly, and each one brings new life to the game, even if you've played for hundreds of hours. Each killer is unique and original, whose abilities are creative and force different tactics for the survivers. The survivors are one of my major problems with the game, as each survivor is nothing but a reskin and a set of teachables. Their gameplay, however, is just as fun as the killers. It captures the essense of survival, most of the time, however there are occasionally higher level players who will understand the game enough to run you around for about 5 hours. As the game progresses though, it continually becomes more and more balanced and fun to play.

This game has very amazing content and the way it was set up is clever. However there are serious downfalls to the game. Major one that is ruining the game and litteraly making matchmaking take insanely longer is the SWF feature which allows you to team up with your friends before joining a match. Most killers will leave the lobby when seeing everyone join as a team and if your the killer why wouldnt you? It is to unfair mainly because high rank 5+ will have one rank 15 or lower in there team and be matched up with a new killer who is also rank 15. And going against player who have all 4 perks while you do not and in teamspeak is not fun. This is ruining the game for both parties and the forums show this. I would avoid this game untill a solution is found.
